title: What are the subtle centers and their activation for higher consciousness?
first_phrase: In this text, the author delves into the subject of subtle centers and their role in spiritual development. It is necessary to have a proper understanding of their nature and ways of functioning to prepare for serious spiritual practice. In the last 200 tokens, the author examines the first of these centers, located between the pituitary gland and the bridge of the nose. It is emphasized that the current materialistic culture has led to a degeneration of these centers, but they can be revived through conscious effort. This text offers valuable insight into the spiritual practices of the human race.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is important to note that under the influence of our current civilization, the subtle centers of the brain have undergone a kind of involution, leading to atrophy due to materialism. However, self-development is always possible, and it is only through this process that a complete possession of these centers can be attained. The first center, located at the base of the nose, is integral to the sense of self and is the conscious enlivener of the other centers. Developing these centers requires introspection and a focus on the inner world as opposed to external stimuli.
